00025 #ifndef UIUC_COMPATIBILITY_H
00026 #define UIUC_COMPATIBILITY_H
00027 
00028 /* These macros and structs are copied directly from the UIUC notes source so
00029  * we can deal with UIUC notesfiles written to disk directly.  Some of the
00030  * names have been changed to protect the innocent (and to avoid collisions
00031  * with global constants); these changes are noted below.
00032  *
00033  * Some macros and structs have been omitted; only definitions related to disk
00034  * operations were needed for the module.
00035  *
00036  * These are the default values as supplied in the release version of UIUC
00037  * notesfiles 1.7.  If your copy of notes was compiled with any of the defaults
00038  * changed in src/structs.h, you might need to change some of the macros
00039  * defined below for compatibility with your installation of UIUC notes.
00040  *
00041  * The UIUC macro "MSTDIR", which was defined in the Makefile, is now a
00042  * configure option: --with-notes-spool=[/var/spool/notes], and is represented
00043  * internally by the macro SPOOL.  This macro applies to all backends, not just
00044  * UIUC.
00045 */
00046 
00047 /* FIXTIMES - you might want to toggle this on if you want to be paranoid about
00048  * your note times being correct in all cases.  Leaving it off should, in the
00049  * real world, be just fine.  FWIW, the UIUC notes source did not define
00050  * FIXTIMES by default.
00051  */
00052 
00053 #undef FIXTIMES
00054 
00055 /* Various miscellaneous constants and maximums */
00056 
00057 #define BUFSIZE    1024
00058 #define DBVERSION  19850101     /* Yes, it really is that old. */
00059 #define DMLEN      40
00060 #define HARDMAX    3000000
00061 #define HOMESYSSZ  33
00062 #define MAXMSG     100000
00063 #define NAMESZ     17
00064 #define NEVER      (-1)
00065 #define NNLEN      40
00066 #define NPERMS     35           /* Can be increased without breaking things. */
00067 #define PASSWDLEN  128          /* ... I think. */
00068 #define RESPSZ     5
00069 #define SYSSZ      33
00070 #define TITLEN     36
00071 #define UNIQPLEX   100000
00072 #define WDLEN      128
00073 
00074 /* Filenames */
00075 
00076 #define ACCESS     "access"
00077 #define BUGCOUNT   "bugcount"
00078 #define NOTEINDX   "note.indx"
00079 #define RESPINDX   "resp.indx"
00080 #define SEQ        ".SEQ"
00081 #define SEQUENCER  ".sequencer"
00082 #define TEXT       "text"
00083 
00084 /* Permission types */
00085 
00086 #define PERMUSER   00
00087 #define PERMGROUP  01
00088 #define PERMSYSTEM 02
00089 
00090 /* Permissions */
00091 
00092 #define READOK     01
00093 #define WRITOK     02
00094 #define DRCTOK     04
00095 #define RESPOK     010
00096 
00097 /* Note options - some names changed slightly */
00098 
00099 #define FROMNEWS    01      /* FRMNEWS in UIUC notes. */
00100 #define DIRMES      04
00101 #define ISDELETED   010     /* DELETED in UIUC notes. */
00102 #define CONTINUED   040
00103 #define WRITONLY    0100
00104 
00105 /* NF options - some names changed slightly */
00106 
00107 #define ANONOK       01
00108 #define ISOPEN       02      /* OPEN in UIUC notes. */
00109 #define ISUNAPPROVED 02
00110 #define NFINVALID    010
00111 #define ISARCHIVE    0400    /* ISARCH in UIUC notes. */
00112 #define ISMODERATED  01000   /* MODERATED in UIUC notes. */

00114 /* Data structures */
00115 
00116 struct auth_f
00117 {
00118   char aname[NAMESZ];
00119   char asystem[HOMESYSSZ];
00120   int aid;
00121 };
00122 
00123 struct when_f
00124 {
00125   short w_year;        /* tm_year + 1900 */
00126   short w_month;       /* tm_mon + 1 */
00127   short w_day;
00128   short w_hours;
00129   short w_mins;
00130   long w_gmttime;      /* This is a time_t masquerading as a long. */
00131 };
00132 
00133 struct id_f
00134 {
00135   char sys[SYSSZ];
00136   long uniqid;
00137 };
00138 
00139 struct perm_f
00140 {
00141   short ptype;         /* User, group, or system. */
00142   char name[NAMESZ];
00143   short perms;
00144 };
00145 
00146 struct daddr_f
00147 {
00148   long addr;           /* For lseeks - this really ought to have been an off_t,
00149                         * but we work with what we're given. */
00150   unsigned long textlen;
00151 };
00152 
00153 struct txtbuf_f
00154 {
00155   char txtbuf[BUFSIZE];
00156 };
00157 
00158 struct resp_f
00159 {
00160   short r_first, r_last;         /* Bounds of this resp_f block. */
00161   struct id_f r_id[RESPSZ];
00162   struct daddr_f r_addr[RESPSZ];
00163   struct when_f r_when[RESPSZ];  /* Date/time of response. */
00164   char r_from[RESPSZ][SYSSZ];    /* System that sent response to us. */
00165   struct when_f r_rcvd[RESPSZ];  /* Date/time for sequencer. */
00166   struct auth_f r_auth[RESPSZ];
00167   char r_stat[RESPSZ];           /* Director/status flags. */
00168   int r_next;                    /* Index of next response_ind. */
00169   int r_previous;                /* Backlinks (currently unused). */
00170 };
00171 
00172 struct note_f
00173 {
00174   struct id_f n_id;
00175   short n_nresp;
00176   char ntitle[TITLEN];
00177   struct auth_f n_auth;
00178   struct when_f n_date;          /* 'Official' time. */
00179   struct when_f n_rcvd;          /* Time received. */
00180   struct when_f n_lmod;          /* Time modified. */
00181   char n_from[SYSSZ];            /* System that sent note to us. */
00182   int n_rindx;                   /* Where the first set of responses lies. */
00183   struct daddr_f n_addr;
00184   char n_stat;                   /* Director/status flags. */
00185 };
00186 
00187 struct descr_f
00188 {
00189   long d_format;                 /* Database format identifier. */
00190   char d_title[NNLEN];
00191   char d_drmes[DMLEN];
00192   short d_plcy;                  /* Equal to 0 if no policy note. */
00193   struct when_f d_lastm;         /* Time modified. */
00194   short d_stat;                  /* Status flags. */
00195   short d_nnote;
00196   struct id_f d_id;              /* Contains unique ID counter. */
00197   struct when_f d_lstxmit;       /* Last network transmit. */
00198   struct when_f d_created;       /* Creation time. */
00199   struct when_f d_lastuse;       /* Last day used. */
00200   long d_daysused;               /* Number of days used. */
00201   long d_rspwrit;                /* Number of responses ever written. */
00202   long d_notwrit;                /* Number of notes ever written. */
00203   long entries;                  /* Number of entries into the notesfile. */
00204   long walltime;                 /* Total seconds spent in notesfile. */
00205   long d_rspread;
00206   long d_notread;
00207   long d_rsprcvd;
00208   long d_notrcvd;
00209   long d_rspxmit;
00210   long d_notxmit;
00211   long d_notdrop;
00212   long d_rspdrop;
00213   long d_orphans;
00214   long netwrkouts;
00215   long netwrkins;
00216   short d_nfnum;                 /* Unique to this notesfile. */
00217   long d_archtime;               /* Archive after X days. */
00218   long d_workset;                /* Minimum number of notes to keep. */
00219   long d_delnote;                /* Number of deleted notes. */
00220   long d_delresp;                /* Number of deleted responses. */
00221   long d_dmesgstat;              /* Use director message for archive? */
00222   long d_archkeep;               /* Keep or delete when archiving. */
00223   long d_adopted;
00224   long d_longnote;               /* Max text length for a note. */
00225   char d_filler[20];             /* Reserved for future use. */
00226 };
00227 
00228 struct io_f
00229 {
00230   int fidtxt;                    /* 'text' file descriptor. */
00231   int fidndx;                    /* 'note.indx' file descriptor. */
00232   int fidrdx;                    /* 'resp.indx' file descriptor. */
00233   struct descr_f descr;          /* Kept updated by critical sections. */
00234   char nf[NNLEN];                /* Notesfile name. */
00235   char basedir[WDLEN];           /* Directory location. */
00236   char fullname[WDLEN];          /* Full pathname. */
00237   char xstring[TITLEN+1];        /* Title search string. */
00238   char xauthor[NAMESZ+SYSSZ+2];  /* Author search string. */
00239   struct when_f stime;
00240   short access;                  /* What sort of access user has. */
00241   int nrspwrit;
00242   int nnotwrit;
00243   long entered;                  /* When the notesfile was entered. */
00244   int nrspread;
00245   int nnotread;
00246   int nnotxmit;
00247   int nrspxmit;
00248   int nnotrcvd;
00249   int nrsprcvd;
00250   int nnotdrop;
00251   int nrspdrop;
00252   int norphans;
00253   int adopted;
00254 };
00255 
00256 struct seq_f
00257 {
00258   char nfname[NNLEN];
00259   struct when_f lastin;           /* Last entry time. */
00260 };
00261 
00262 #endif /* not UIUC_COMPATIBILITY_H */
